billboardManager

Interface BillboardManagerInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BillboardManager

    public interface BillboardManagerInterface
    This interface defines how one can interact with a billboard manager. The billboard manager class provides an ability to scroll parts of a longer message on a display as well as to show the current time to the user.
    Author:
    schilling

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplayedMessage

        java.lang.String getDisplayedMessage()
        This method will return from a billboard manager the portion of the message that is to be displayed. The portion of the message that is to be displayed will be characters in width and will start an an offset between 0 and the length of the string. The text can be scrolled left by a call to the scroll left method.
        Returns:
        The return will be the string that is to be displayed.

      • getHours

        int getHours()
        This method will return the hours variable that has been set within this class.
        Returns:
        The hours will be returned.

      • getMinutes

        int getMinutes()
        This method will return the minutes variable that has been set within this class.
        Returns:
        The minutes will be returned.

      • getSeconds

        int getSeconds()
        This method will return the seconds variable that has been set within this class.
        Returns:
        The seconds will be returned.

      • setMessage

        void setMessage(java.lang.String message)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will cause a new message to be displayed on the billboard. The current message will be removed and the new message will be shown.
        Parameters:
        message - This is the new message that is to be displayed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This exception will be thrown if the message is null.

      • scrollLeft

        boolean scrollLeft(int numberOfCharacters)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will cause the text that is displayed to scroll a number of characters to the left.
        Parameters:
        numberOfCharacters - This is the number of characters to scroll.
        Returns:
        The return will be true if there are more characters to scroll through or false if the end of the message has been reached.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This exception will be thrown if the number of characters to scroll is negative.

      • setHours

        void setHours(int hours)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will set the current hours that can be used by a TOD display.
        Parameters:
        hours - The hours is the value of hours.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The hours must be between 0 and 23. Otherwise, an Illegal Argument exception will be thrown.

      • setMinutes

        void setMinutes(int minutes)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will set the current minutes that can be used by a TOD display.
        Parameters:
        hours - The hours is the value of minutes.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The minutes must be between 0 and 59. Otherwise, an Illegal Argument exception will be thrown.

      • setSeconds

        void setSeconds(int seconds)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will set the current seconds that can be used by a TOD display.
        Parameters:
        hours - The hours is the value of seconds.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The seconds must be between 0 and 59. Otherwise, an Illegal Argument exception will be thrown.

      • setWidth

        void setWidth(int width)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        This method will set the width of the billboard that is to display the message. The width must be positive.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the billboard must be positive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This exception will be thrown if the value for the billboard is less than 0.

      • subscribe

        void subscribe(BillboardObserverInterface obs)
        This method will add a new observer to the class. The observer will be called whenever a change is made to an internal variable. There can be many different observers. Each will be called in the sequence that it was added as an observer.
        Parameters:
        obs - This is the instance of the observer that is being added.
